item.copy: Idea Hatches, Jack and Pres decide that good jobs with steady pay are overrated, Jack and Preston develop business plan.
Technekes acquires first "real" client, Derivion, an e-payment dot-com. Jack and Preston decline job offers from Rooster.com. Instead, make them the second "real" client, another dot-com.
Jack installs server rack in the kitchen of his rented house. Power requirements are too great for the small house's old electrical system. Blows many fuses!
Technekes opens first "real" office. A loft apartment at the renovated Lance cracker plant near uptown Charlotte.
Rooster.com dies. Derivion is sold. Jack and Preston are left with no clients and no income!
Months of starvation ends with acquisition of first large, agriculture client. First invoice is a whopping $700!
Kristin Terdik joins our team to help oversee work with Lowe's and GE Capital.
Breaks the $1 million sales mark.

Technekes moves to a 4,000 sq ft office at the Pattern Shop in the Cedar Street Design Center. Subleases from an architect who took on too much space. Technekes is a marketing company among a sea of interior designers!
Ashley Williams joins as SVP, Director of Client Services.
Technekes lands its first animal health client, the biggest in the industry.
Breaks the $4 million sales mark.
Unable to find suppliers to meet our best-in-class standards, Technekes opens its own Customer Support Center and Call Center at 1318 Dale St. in Raleigh.
Dale McKee joins Technekes as VP Client Development.
Technekes acquires its first pharmaceutical industry client. We were brought along when a key client contact transitioned from animal health to pharma. Became a preferred supplier within six months.
Scott Miner joins Technekes as Director of Creative Services and opens the Creative Services Department.
Kristin Terdik earns the first ever Technekes Top Gear Award.
Evolved our services model to begin intensive sales support activities for the country's largest financial services company.
Breaks the $6 million sales mark.
Top Gear Award: Mike Lewis.
Steve Amedio assumes role of Chief Operating Officer to run day-to-day operations of the Technekes. Previously, Steve was a close consultant of Technekes' since 2001.
Breaks the $8 million sales mark.
Top Gear Award: Diana Henderson.
Technekes moves its Customer Care Center to Perimeter Park in Morrisville, NC. Acquires over 13,000 sq ft to accommodate significant growth in these operations.
We managed to grow 25% in the midst of the worst economic time in the US since the Great Depression.
Breaks the $12 million sales mark.
Top Gear Award: Crystal Stallings.
Technekes moves Charlotte headquarters location to 10,000 sq ft location in South End.
